intro: Phlebocalymna, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and are native to tropical regions of the Americas. Phlebocalymna species typically have a short, rhizomatous stem and produce inflorescences that consist of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and stream banks. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
